sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Differentiate the function f(x) = 4x^3 with respect to x using the power rule.
message_2:
To differentiate the function f(x) = 4x^3 with respect to x using the power rule, we apply the rule:

(d/dx) [x^n] = nx^(n-1)

In this case, n = 3. So, applying the power rule to f(x) = 4x^3, we get:

f'(x) = 4 * (3x^(3-1))
f'(x) = 12x^2

So, the derivative of f(x) = 4x^3 with respect to x is f'(x) = 12x^2.
